<Text: San Nicolas Island is the most remote of California's Channel Islands, located 61 miles (98 km) from the nearest point on the mainland coast.>

Text: San Nicolas Island:  The 14,562 acre (58.93 km or 22.753 sq mi) island is currently controlled by the United States Navy and is used as a weapons testing and training facility, served by Naval Outlying Field San Nicolas Island.

Text: San Nicolas Island:  As of the 2000 U.S. Census, the island has since remained officially uninhabited, though the census estimates that at least 200 military and civilian personnel live on the island at any given time.
